item.title: No child abuse here
item.dc:creator: @johnl17 johnl17
item.description:
@johnl17 wrote:

“Canadian Doctor’s Research On Corporal Punishment Psychological Damages.”

U.S. – 7 Feb 12

Spanking kids can cause long-term harm: Canada study

Spanking children can cause long-term developmental damage and may even lower a child's IQ, according to a new Canadian analysis that seeks to shift the ethical debate over corporal punishment into the medical sphere.

Read full topic

item.title: No child abuse here
item.dc:creator: @Cole1497 Cole1497
item.description:
@Cole1497 wrote:

Javafire:

wimp, afraid to get beaten by your own father?..

No, I never said I was afraid, I said I viewed it as wrong.

Javafire:

at least the child isn’t being killed.

Oh, that makes it okay.

Javafire:

What doesn’t kill you only makes u stronger.

False. I had a friend who was in a terrible car accident, and he was put into a coma. Is he dead? No. Is he stronger? No.

Read full topic

item.title: No child abuse here
item.dc:creator: @Javafire Javafire
item.description:
@Javafire wrote:

[quote=“Cole1497, post:15, topic:380849”][quote author=Ix Soulcist xI link=topic=476674.msg3486353#msg3486353 date=1296603981]
Spanking a child is something normal, and not against the law. I don’t know about it being against the law in public. I would beat the hell out of mine, if he took participation in a gang, I would rather go to jail being mine for being in a gang, than him being in a gang, and going to jail for like 10 Years.
[/quote]
If the man used his hands, I would think the video is funny. But since he was using an object that would probably leave bruises, I view it as wrong.[/quote]
wimp, afraid to get beaten by your own father?..
But forealz, it’s not that bad, at least the child isn’t being killed. What doesn’t kill you only makes u stronger.

Read full topic
